text: St. Francis Xavier (1506–1552) is a Spanish Roman Catholic saint. St. Francis Xavier may also refer to: ==Localities== * St. François Xavier, Manitoba, an unincorporated urban centre in Canada * Saint-François Xavier des Missions étrangères, a parish in the 7th arrondissement of Paris ==People== * Saint Francis Xavier Bianchi (1743–1815), an Italian priest and scholar * Saint Frances Xavier Cabrini (1850–1917), an Italian-American Religious Sister, founder of the Missionary Sisters of the Sacred Heart of Jesus ==Other uses== * List of schools named after Francis Xavier, various colleges and schools * St. Francis Xavier University, an undergraduate university located in Antigonish, Nova Scotia, Canada * St. Francis Xavier Church (disambiguation), various churches and cathedrals * Saint-François-Xavier (Paris Métro), a station on line 13 of the Paris Métro ==See also== * San Franciscu Xavier-a, tuji kudd-i Goeam xara, a Konkani hymn in tribute to Saint Francis Xavier * St. Francis (disambiguation) * St. Xavier (disambiguation) * San Xavier (disambiguation) * Xavier (disambiguation) * San Javier (disambiguation)
title: St. Francis Xavier (disambiguation)
